resources:
Jnanagni
Open navigation drawer Close navigation drawer Settings Gurukul Kangri Vishwavidyalaya is not just a mere institution but it'san academy where the cerebral and cultural erudition receptacles are interminably augmenting since 1902. On behalf of Faculty of Engineering and Technology, Gurukul Kangri Vishwavidyalaya, we introduce you the Jnanagni 18, the National level Techno-Cultural Fest, which began its journey from 2006 with huge success.

 Jnanagni is an effort with the message to have "Enlightenment Everywhere" - the Enlightenment of Knowledge, Creativity and Success. Jnanagni aims to celebrate the festival of Experimentation and Learning. The Plethora of Events that Jnanagni promises is designed in a way to Challenge all the Dimension of a Student's Cerebrum and we try to keep assure that the Winner is 'Knowledge' in the end. It will be a pleasure to have you become a part of Jnanagni by way of Sponsorship, Valuable Suggestions, Academic Inputs. Sponsoring Jnanagni means ubiquitous reach, unprecedented mass viability and a growth to your brand equity.

Teams have to make a rope climbing machine using only hydraulic mechanisms, should be able to push the ball from an adjacent platform. 
In this action it will have to compete with another machine in a knockout tournament. 

 There would be two Major Checkpoints. Each major checkpoint has two minor checkpoints.
 The completion of the minor checkpoints will be considered as completion of major checkpoint.
 The minor checkpoints in a particular major checkpoint can be completed in any order.
 The minor checkpoints will be used for reinstallation during the run.
 The minor checkpoints are -
 - Pushing the ball of the platform
 - All the parts of the bot must cross the corresponding distance line for the platform i.e. 500mm/1000mm..
 



Arena Description
 	• The arena will be four ropes. The ropes will look like corners of a square when arena is seen from the top.
 	• There will be a central rigid pipe at the centre of square mentioned in point 1.
 	• The ropes will be tied at both the ends to rigid surfaces. The rope will be taut.
 	• The horizontal distance between the ropes, on the diagonally opposite ends, will be 600 mm.(figure1)
 	• The rope would be a jute rope of diameter approximately 40 mm.
 	• There would be platforms at three different levels attached to a support pillar at distances of 500mm, 1000 mm, and 2000 mm from the start line. (Please refer to the diagram below for further details about the platform).
 	• The Arena from here on is defined form the perspective of a single rope; it will be the same for the remaining ropes.
 	• The distance from the centre of the rope to the centre of platform support pillar will be 300 mm.
 	• Each rope has a corresponding platform.
 	• The distance between the centre of the rope to the near end of the platform will be 200mm.(refer figures)
 	• There would be a table tennis ball of diameter 40 mm kept on the platform at a distance of 50mm from the end i.e at a distance of 250mm from the centre of the rope.
 	• The balls will be held stationary by mounting them on a holder. (Refer figure 2)
 	• The topmost platform will have a single ball at the centre of the support pillar. This ball will be at a distance of 300mm from the centre of the rope.
 


Machine Specifications
 	• Machine should fit into a box of dimension 300 mm x 300 mm x 300 mm at the time of start. There is no restriction on the height of the machine. The extensions used to control the machine are excluded while measuring the machine dimensions.
 	• Machine can expand or compress during the run.
 	• Locomotion of any part of the machine should be governed by some hydraulic force.
 	• Use of batteries or any other source of stored energy is prohibited.
 	• Use of any type of electrical motors, springs, compressor and pressurised cylinders is prohibited.

 Controls
 	• The machine should only be controlled with the help of syringes(any other cylinder piston arrangement).
 	• Maximum of two people will be allowed to control the machine at any point of time.
 

 Materials allowed
 Any material from this list can be used in making the machine:
 	1. Syringes (or any other cylinder-piston arrangement)
 	2. Tubes
 	3. Wood
 	4. Metallic frames
 	5. Rubber bands
 	6. Plastic
 	7. Water
 	8. Metal pulleys Ever came across the team ‘blind-coding’ ? Well this enthralling event would provide an opportunity to showcase your coding skills but in a different way. Task which has to performed, will be decided by organizers but cannot be disclosed beforehand.
 Candidates will know it at the venue.
		ROBOT SPECIFICATION 
1.The robot can have maximum dimension of: 
	Length- 30cm 
	Width - 30cm 
	Height - 30cm.

2. The motor to be used can have a maximum of 200 RPM.

Power Specification 
- The potential difference between any two terminals should not exceed 12V. 
- AC power supply will be provided. 
 DESCRIPTION OF ARENA


	Robo-terrain

- The track may consist of obstacles like:-
 - Gravels with obstacles.
 - Valleys, see-saw.
 - Steps, slopes, rotating element, slippery floor.
 - The time limit is a maximum of 5 minutes.
 - Width of track is 35cm.



Robo-war 
Arena Specifications and guidelines

-Arena will be a rectangular area of dimension 3.5m X 3.5m.
 -The arena will have holes. Pushing the opponent bot into one of the holes will fetch points.(50 points)
 -The arena will have pebbles. Pushing the opponent bot on to the pebbles will fetch points.(30 points)
 -The arena will have a central region marked by a circle area.
 -The starting point will be inside that circle
 -The team which will throw the other one outside the circle will get the high score point (100 points)
 -The time limit of game is 15minutes.



Robo-soccer

Arena Specifications and guidelines

-Arena will be a rectangular area of dimension as shown below.
 -Rectangular ground with two goal post

CODEATHON provides you a platform to bring out the developer in you. A developer who can solve the real life problems, a developer who can code the new ideas. The event has three rounds which test your circuit debugging skills.
 

 ROUND 1
 	In this round 10 general aptitude and 10 simple electronics and electrical related questions will be given.time provided for this round 30 min. participant are required to have basic knowledge of electronics and electrical.
 

 ROUND 2
 	Participants who are selected to the second round are tested on their knowledge of digital circuitry. In this round 5 digital electronics questions will be given and they are supposed to identify the faults and rectify the circuit.time for this round is 45 min. in this round 5 analog circuit questions will also given. Paricipants are supposed to find the bugs and solve them. Time for this round is 45 min.
 

 ROUND 3
 	Participants selected to this round are given a hardware circuit either digital or analog fault in the circuit should be identified to get the correct output. Time for this round is 2 hours
 It is generally a series of process which is linking to one another. It just require a initial triggering and rest is spontanepous. So this event will testify your innate ability to link the key pieces of something so creative that would itself be a marvel…… Are you ready to show your knowledge about electronics .Knowledge about application of electronics equipment .Where you have to arrange these in such a way what we think! Then come and become the hero of electronics era.
This event consist of 3 Rounds. 

 Round 1
 	In first level the participants will be given three messages which they have to decode and on the basis of their correctness they would be judged.
 


Round 2
 	In the second level participants will be given different objects which they have to utilize or analyze to get the clue for the next level. This level will include the usage of Physics, Chemistry, Basic Electronics lab, Machine lab, and Computer Center.
 


Round 3
 	This level is a "top secret", will be disclosed on successful entry.

This event will be hosted on Hackerearth.

 Round 1
 	1. Quiz competition of MCQ type
 	2. Questions related to basic algorithms and programming (30min time limit)
 

 Round 2
 	Participants will have to code according to the instructions provided (3hrs time limit)

Ever wondered the concept of the Leaning tower of Pisa. Its time to construct your own inclined structure using materials defined below in rules. Then it will be tested for its strength and stability. Make your structure as inclined as possible but keep in mind about its strength. At the same time they have to take care of the accuracy too. Life as it is, is riddled with problems, both easy and complex. Most of these problems have solutions, and we tend to solve them manually and laboriously.
 Did we hear a "no"? Maybe you prefer more elegant solutions, perhaps even automating them. Hence, we present Cuandigo, bringing you an opportunity, to showcase your skills in solving real-life problems, because hey, we've got loads of them. Debugging is the process of finding and resolving of defects that prevent correct operation of computer software or a system. Thus, this event is all about finding the nasty and mischievous bug(s) making our creation futile. Enhance your skill with figuring out the bugs. This event will involve extempore in the first round and a debate in the second.


For Extempore
 	Participant have to pickout a paper from the random-box which contains three topic of three fields like science ,social science, art, politics, entertainment etc. and He/She have speak on any topic written in his/her paper in very less time.

	Levels:
 Level 1:- Participant will have 30 sec to think about that topic and 1 min to speak on it.In this level all registered participant are eligible.
Level 2:- Participant will have 5 min to think about that topic and 3 min to speak on it. Only top-5 from level 1 are eligible.


For Debate
 	The debate will be held on currently trending topics. The topic will be given by the organizers at the end of EXTEMPORE Level-1, so you'll have enough time to prepare about the topic.

	The participant should also be among the top 12 participants of the EXTEMPORE event.

All categories in photography and video will accept entries from any digital device, including smartphones.
If you're a person who loves solving riddles, if the word "adventure" makes adrenaline rush through your body, if you want to explore the campus or just want to make some new friends – treasure hunt is what might catch your fancy which is a game in which players search for hidden objects by following a trail of clues. Humans so called the super computers are the mass stroge of the data. If one need to acess to this data start googling the brain. Q-congnito provides you the platform to google. This is to expose the inner spirit of writing hidden in you to the outside world.
The more you expose the more you learn.
 So BURN THE INNER YOU AND SHINE FOR OTHERS.
 	• Freedoscrawl is the event organized by the fetians of gurukula kangri Vishwavidyalaya haridwar.
 	• There will be total 3 rounds, which are to test the writing skills of contestants in each field and they are given the freedom to choose their field of interest.
 	***** Here 	1. *Anything refers to anything that is your comfort zone of writing AS ART FLOODS FROM OUR HEART.
 
Prizes for champions and winners-
 	• First prize-
 		Premium membership of Grammarly.
 		Heaps of Books.
 		 Certificate of championship.

Ever thought what you would do if you got a chance to build your own IPL team? To use your knowledge of the 'Big Game' and your sixth sense to create the perfect team that goes on to lift the coveted Trophy? To use permutations and combinations and make the best choice keeping in mind the huge investment that goes into putting together a winning team? To learn Strategizing, Resource Management, Entrepreneurship, all at the same time in a fun-filled Cricketing event? 

This April, grab the chance to build your very own IPL team. This is an event for those who not only love Cricket but analyze it to the limits. This event lets you put your feet in the boots of a bidder. You have to manage your budget along with picking the right side. 

The event will constitute of two rounds:

PRELIMINARY ROUND
 	This is the eliminator round. In this round the teams have to take a pen paper quiz based on Cricket, to check their awareness about the cricket world. The questions will be strictly based on Cricket. Top ten teams with highest score will get qualified for the next round. 
	Duration: 30 minutes


FINAL ROUND
 	This includes the real bidding mechanism. Going with the real mechanism of the IPL bidding, this round will contain 8 teams. Each team will be given an equal amount of money(imaginary) for the bidding. The players will be assigned base prize and points. Aim of the event is to build a team with maximum points. 
	Each team will have to bid for a franchisee. Then, they are expected to assemble a team with a mix of batsmen, bowlers, all-rounders and wicket-keepers from a pool of players being auctioned. 
	A list of all players available for the auction, along with their base price and value points will be provided to the teams in the beginning. Bidding for each player will begin at his base price. Team with highest value points at the end of the auction will be declared as the winner.
The Kalakriti will terminate in two levels as described below:


Primary Level (Sketching)
 	A common topic will be provided on the spot for sketching for everyone. This is the Qualifier round. The top 50% of the contestents will be selected for the next round.


Secondory Level
 	There will be a common topic for painting and you have to paint by using water colour.

The topic chosen is entirely up to the participant. Show your skills and creativity on the poster.
Carrom (also known as Karrom) is a "strike and pocket" table game of Eastern origin similar to billiards and table shuffleboard. Chess is a two-player strategy board game played on a chessboard, a checkered gameboard with 64 squares arranged in an eight-by-eight grid Chess is played by millions of people worldwide, both amateurs and professionals. Table tennis, also known as ping pong, is a sport in which two or four players hit a lightweight ball back and forth across a table using a small bat. The game takes place on a hard table divided by a net. 1.The game version will be the Need for Speed Most Wanted 2005. 
2.For qualifying round all participants have to play a circuit race with 2 laps. 
3.The qualifying round race will be same for all participants and the time will be noted of the total race time of each participants. 
4.The first 12 participants will be advanced in next level. 
5.Then they will be playing in the groups of 4 participants in each group in a Sprint race. 
6.The winner of all there groups will be advanced in the final. 
7.The final race will also be a Sprint race there the winner and runner-up will be decided. 
8.Use of cheat codes could lead to disqualification.
1.The game version will be the Counter Strike Source or 1.6. 
2.The maximum participants in each team will be 4.

3.The teams face each others in knockout rounds where the winner and runner-up teams decided. 
4.The level/stage will be random. 
5.The sides will be decided by auto assign by any team member. 
6.The knockout rounds will be best of five. 
7.The final will be the best of seven. 
8.Use of cheat codes could lead to disqualification.
1.The game version will be Fifa 14.
 2.The first round will be qualifying round where participants can choose any team and have to play against the chosen team’s rival in difficulty level of Professional Class. 
3.The stats of every participants will be note down.
 4.The top 5 winners will be passed on to the next round where difficulty level will be increase to World Class. 
5.In case of there is not enough winners in qualifying round the participants (who gets draw) with the best stats will be passed on to next round.
 6.In 2nd round the winner and runner-up will be decided accordingly their stats or results.
 7.In case of there is no winner than the tie breaker round will be played.
 8.Use of cheat codes could lead to disqualification.

The exhilaration and enthusiasm gets a new Dias in Jñānāgni to showcase itself in a contrasting way, the reason is Rock Syndrome. The competition now not restricted to an individual but an entire group or what we call as a "BAND". Every band will put in everything they've got to produce breath-taking and super-exhilarating music to set the stage on fire and driving the audience crazy. Dance is a performance art form consisting of purposefully selected sequences of human movement. This movement has aesthetic and symbolic value, and is acknowledged as dance by performers and observers within a particular culture. There will be only one round in which your qualities such as consistency, voice, entertainment, rhythm, and melody will be judged.
 To get into the event however, you should clear our audition round.
CRAFT is skill where we have to make things with hands with your mind's creativity. Explore yourself in the world of craft . This time Jnanagni , FET welcomes everyone to show your creativity through craft.
 
This competition consists of three levels:
 Primary Level (paper craft):-
 	 In this level you have to prepare a meaningful concept of your wish by using craft papers which will be provided by us . the 50% of the contest will be selected from this round .
 Secondary Level (mosaic):-
 	 In this level you have to prepare a mosaic of your wish by using buttons which will be provided by us . The 50% of the contestant will be selected from this round.

Final Level (wire sculpture):-
 	 In this level you have to prepare any 3D object or innovate things by using u=copper wire which will be provided by us . Top three contestants will be selected 
 
 Note:-		You have to bring your own geometry stuff , Scissors etc as per the level requirement.

Jnanagni brings to you right from the streets, a louder and larger than life exchange of ideologies with drama full of drums, catchy songs, humour, energy, emotions and the roar of audience. Nukkad Natak as a form of communication is deeply rooted in the Indian tradition. It breaths the formal barriers and approaches the people directly in order to bring upon change for the good. This Jnanagni come and convey a social or political message in an entertaining environment and move the junta dumbstruck giving inspiring performances. So get along and HALLA BOL! Recoupling Alumni’s with their alma-mater. It is an annual crown Jewel event of Student Alumni Meet, which will be entering its third Phase this year, with some untouched event but with the same gray-haired motive of bringing student and alumni in sync. The meet is now a major event anticipated by both the alumni and the students. As the years pass by and wind of change keep blowing, the alumni meet too shall keep evolving with the pace of time, hoping to bring the alumni an experience that they may cherish all their lives.
There will be a grand celebration with the celebrity on 8th April, 2018. 
 The details will be out once the celebrity is fixed.
Our goal is to give something to the startup community by introducing emerging startups to resources, mentorship, and investment opportunities. We are most interested in working with entrepreneurs using data management to solve public policy, human development, and business challenges. Architecting, analyzing, and managing data in an effective manner is a great challenge and a tremendous area of opportunity for new business innovation. The sensation of 80s is back and piquantly its revival would enthrall one and all participating. So its time for the speedcubers to gear up for the challenge as speed and time will be of essence.
Comedy is a genre of film in which the main emphasis is on Humour. These films are designed to make the audience laugh through amusement and most often through their expressions. Comedy Central brings you the funniest stuff on the planet. It refers to any discourse or work generally intended to be humorous or amusing by inducing laughter, especially in theatre. 
It's a plateform where the performers tickles the audience with the best of your comic skills .Be the reason for all the giggles and laughs around.
	1. The teams must adhere to the spirit of healthy competition.
 	2. Any team that is not ready at the time specified will be disqualified from the competition automatically.
 	3. The organizers reserve all rights to change any of the above rules as they deem fit. Change in rules, if any will be highlighted on the website.
 	4. In case of any discrepancy decision of the judges shall be treated as final and binding on all.
 [!$] Round 1 
 	A simple code with syntax error will be given on paper.
 	Participants have to correct the errors on paper and type the code with MONITOR SWITCHED OFF.
 	Ten minutes will be given to type and correct the code.
 	Based on the results of first round 20 participants will be selected for second round.
 

\ Round 2
 	Every participants will be given same problem .
 	Time limit in this level will be 30 min.
 	Marking will be based on their logic, programming skill and minimum error .
 	10 participants will be selected for next level.
 



Round 3
 	5 problems will be given to each participant .
 	Put your all programming skill together, in this level your screen will not be turned off.
 	Time limit is 1 and half hours.
 	Marking will be based on their logic, programming skill.
 	1. Participants can form a team(max. 3 members) or can participate on a singular basis.
 	2. Two rounds will be conducted(both linked).
 	3. First round will be of writing code for the task, Secound will be 'hardware implementation'. Adequate hardware components/kit will be provided.
 	4. Each round will have time constraints. However, if 'code writing' gets completed before allotted time ,remaining time can be utilized in 2nd round to maximize winning chances.
 	5. If a participant/team fails to write code, then it is meaningless to get into further round. Hence failure in round one will automatically lead to elimination.(Generation of hex file will be analyzed).
 	6. To facilitate hardware implementation and debugging, participant may use 'Proteus Isis' (simulation purpose). Proteus will not be provided by us.

		Robo-terrain
 1.Maximum of five members are allowed in a team, where only two of them are allowed on the arena at a time.
 2.The robot should not damage the arena
 3.It is your responsibility to take care of all type of equipment i.e , wire connection or any sort of robot assembly parts. 
 4.No arguments regarding this issue will be entertained. The organizer decision regarding this issue or any other issue will be final.
 5.No technical assistance will be provided by the organizing team at the time of event.
 6.The Team completing the track in least time will get the certificate and prize.

Note	 Extra point will be rewarded for autonomous robot. For any queries contact to organizer


		Robo-War 
1.Maximum of five members are allowed in a team, where only two of them are allowed on the arena at a time.

2.It is your responsibility to take care of all type of equipment i.e , wire connection or any sort of robot assembly parts.
 3.No arguments regarding this issue will be entertained. The organizer decision regarding this issue or any other issue will be final.
4.No technical assistance will be provided by the organizing team at the time of event. 
5.The Team with highest score will get the certificate and prize. 
Note	 Extra point will be rewarded for autonomous robot. For any queries contact to organizer.


		Robo-soccer 
1.Maximum of five members are allowed in a team, where only two of them are allowed on the arena at a time.

2.It is your responsibility to take care of all type of equipment i.e , wire connection or any sort of robot assembly parts. 
3.No arguments regarding this issue will be entertained. The organizer decision regarding this issue or any other issue will be final. 
4.No technical assistance will be provided by the organizing team at the time of event. 
5.Time period of the game is 20minutes 
6.Team with max number of goal will win. 
7.The winning team will get the certificate and prize.

Note 	Extra point will be rewarded for autonomous robot. For any queries contact to organizer
1. A team can have a maximum of 3 members. The team members should be from the same college. Multiple teams from the same college are allowed and encouraged.
 2. No participant can be a part of more than one team.
 3. The competition will be conducted in 2 rounds.
 4. Teams which do not adhere to the rules and regulations can be disqualified at any phase of the event.
 5. In case of any dispute, the decision of the judges and Jnanagni Organizing Committee will be final and binding.
 Teams have to build an application for one of the below mentioned themes:-
 	1. Right against exploitation.
	2. Education and Literacy. 
	3. Automation. 
	4. Health and medication. 
	5. Namo Ganga. 
	6. FET- Extra 5 marks will be rewarded to a team that builds a project that leads to betterment of FET.
There are no constraints on the technology and platform used .The teams can build a mobile application or website or a desktop application as per there choice and interest
The teams need to mail a short abstract of their idea by 31 March 2018 to organizers. The abstract must include :- 
	1. Theme Chosen. 
	2. Your Idea. 
	3. Technologies Used. 
	4. Team Details.

ATTeam may comprise of 1-3 members. 
Teams need to present their project idea and the working of project through a presentation.
 Teams must bring their own laptops for presentation. Working of mobile applications may be displayed by making screen-casts or using Vysor.
ROUND 1
 	Participants would be selected on the basis of there knowledge about electronics.
 	To check knowledge of participants we will give them 100 questions.
 	Participants will achieve virtual money in this ROUND on the basis of there performance.
 	They have to use these money in ROUND 2.
 


ROUND 2
 	Participants will be given a circuit.
 	They have to make it with help of components.
 	They will get these components on their virtual money.
 	1. Number of participants should not be more than 3 in a team.
 	2. If any one found mishandling the given objects he/she will be disqualified.
 	3. All decisions by the organizers are deemed final and cannot be questioned, however, they can give an explanation if requested.

	1. All Rules of HackerEarth.
 	2. Participant can use any language supported by HackerEarth Platform.

1) All the participants have to construct the leaning tower and present it to the judges for technical inspection only.
 2) Your tower must fulfilled the basic requirement like Material constraints
 		- Popsicle sticks having length upto 11cm
 		- Wooden Base must fulfill the Dimension of 17cmx17cm

		- Fevicol
 3) Any rules or information are subject to change and nothing could be held liable against the Coordinators or the university staff 	In such case, the decision of the management and organizing committee would be final.

Cuandigo will be held in two rounds. 
Round 1
 	Participants will be given 5 general algorithmic problems to solve.
 	Although these won't necessarily be related to real-life problems, they'll help assessing your programming skills.
 	Problems will involve the use of Data Structures, so brush up on them, before typing away.
 	Duration: 2 Hrs
 
 Round 2
 	This round actually involves the problems as advertised, and will allow only the top 50% of the participants who qualify from the previous round. Participants will be given one problem each (not necessarily unique) to solve. Example topics are Graph Colouring, Route Finding, Scheduling, Bin Packing, etc.
 Duration: 3 Hrs

Participants are required to find bug in our program written in language C. There will be two rounds. Their description are as follows-
 	 1. First round includes four questions. Time duration is 1 hr and 30 min to find and fix the bug.
 	 2. Second round consists of two questions. Time duration is 1 hr.

	1. Participant should registered online for the this event threw Jnanagni website.
 	2. He/She should have Jnanagni Identity-Card.
 	3. There will four teams three students named as Team-A, Team-B, Team-C and Team-D
 	4. The team will grouped as below:
 		Top-1, 8, 9 of EXTEMPORE will be in Team-A
 		Top-2, 7, 10 of EXTEMPORE will be in Team-B
 		Top-3, 6, 11 of EXTEMPORE will in Team-C
 		Top-4, 5,12 of EXTEMPORE will in Team-D
 5. The participant can bring only pen, papers, newspaper cuttings on the desk for Debate. No electronic items are allowed.
 6. The topic will be explained by the organizer and passed to Team-A to start.
 7. Team-A will speak on that topic for 5 minutes and then Team-B will have to oppose the Team-A and then Team-C, Team-D have to put their views and so on..
		 Entry Rules 
•Entrants are restricted to only college students pursuing their bachelors or masters, and school students of Class 11th and 12th. 
•Enter the contest by providing the required information in the event registration form (Click here for the Google Form). This form will become available on the first date entries are accepted (Tuesday, March 14, 2018). 
•Entry Period [Tuesday, March 14, 2018 - Saturday, March 31, 2018].

	Submission Rules 
•Only 1 photo per participant is allowed to be submitted. 
•Images that have been retouched using software or by other means will be accepted. Retouched photography using a camera app or photo editing app is also accepted. 
•File size: up to 10 MB
This event will test the speed and intelligence of the participants. Teams will be selected based on how well they perform in the preliminary round. All rounds will be held in FET. Clues could be inside any building, field or area.
 In each round the qualified number groups will be selected on a first come first serve basis provided they have completed the trail of that round.

 

Rules:-
 	1. Open to all who register for JNANAGNI.
 	2. Only 4 hunters per team.
 	3. A preliminary round (ROOM NO. 208, FET) will be held to select the only eligible team.
 	4. The Team That Stays Together. Your team must stay together at all times. You may not split up to “divide” tasks.
 	5. Playing Fair. Have fun and try to win. But don’t let your competitive instincts drive you to ruin other people’s chances o win. If you do, your team will be disqualified. That means no sabotaging, lying, cheating, stealing, or copying other people’s work.
 	6. Cheaters Never Win. If anyone on your team cheats or breaks the rules, the whole team gets disqualified
 	7. Rules can be altered anytime for the sake of convenience.
 	8. The decision of organizers will be the final.
 	9. No mobile phones & technology
 There are three Quizzes:

1. BIZ-QUIZ
 The Business Quiz

 2. SLAM DUNK
 The Sports Quiz

 3. INDIA QUIZ
 All about India

 Each Quiz will have two rounds
 	 1. PRELIMS 	 It is a pen and paper round with 20 questions 
 	 2. STAGE ROUNDS
 	 It is an audio-visual round .


 Rules:-
 1. A maximum of 10 seconds is allowed to answer a question.
 2. Questions are passed on to the next team if the current team is unable to answer.
 3. It is a two member team event. Lone wolves can also participate.
 4. Use of any electronic devices is prohibited.
 Round 0: The online round-
 	Present a poem or story or any tale in just 100 words and mail it to us.
 	Do mention your name, college name, place, and contact details along with it.
 	50% marks will be of the likes and shares you get on social networking site and 50% marks will be based on Expert judgment.
 
Round 1: COO—the birth of sparrow-
 	Total time-15 minutes.
 	Part (a): Warming of Eggs
 	Time limit--- 10 minutes
 	Different themes will be given in packets and candidates will have to choose a theme among the given set of themes. Candidate will have to write according to the theme. 	Part (b): Hatching of Eggs
 	Time limit--- 5 minutes
 	Word limit--- 50 words.
 	 Candidates will have to write a summary of the writing submitted in part a.
 
Round 2: Expose --- Nurturing
 	Time limit--- 20 minutes
 	Participants will be provided with colorful cards on which there will be written keywords.
 	They have to write anything creative using the card's keyword.
 	Candidates may use the hints provided on the cards provided.
 
Round 3: Burning Train--- The ultimate flight
 	Time limit---15 minutes.
 	Word limit--- NO limit
 	Express your best memories.
 
	Concepts for Tie-Breaker RoundTime
 	limit--- 12 minutes.
 	Word limit--- No limit
 	Express the love of your life in a tale or a short poem.



NOTE:- 
 	•The content provided in any round should not be copied and should be 100% unique on plagiarism tests.OTHERWISE you will be disqualified.


 RULES:-
 1. Writings provided in online round should be unique and 100% plagiarism free.
 2. Copied work will not be tolerated and their candidature will be rejected.
 3. The decision of Organizing committee and judges will be the sole decision and no objections are expected.
 4. Those whosoever are not present at the event and have participated in online round would be disqualified.
 1. Every team should consist a maximum of TWO members.
 2. Every team has to register for jnanagni 17. 
 3. The decision of judges and event coordinators shall be treated as final and binding to all.
 4. A basic knowledge of digital and digital and analog circuitry is necessary. 
 5. Any malpractice is strictly treated and is submitted to the jnanagni disciplinary committee.

1. Start from a height of 4 feet.
 2. End the series by hitting a pyramid of glasses using rolling of ball in a final unguided run of 3 feet by building a contraption conforming to the specified design features.
 3. At least 2 ping pong balls are to be used in the reaction, one of which should be dropped in a cup (regular size circular tea cup) from height of 3 feet and once dropped the ball must stay in the cup. (10 pts.) [Mandatory]
 4. Make a parallel chain (first chain must be of dominoes and second chain must be of another material) that will diverge from a same point at the same time and also converges into a single chain at the same time. (5+10 pts.) [Mandatory]
 5. Turn on a light. (5pts.) [optional]
 6. Burst a balloon. (5pts.) [optional]
 7. In the Final Task, 2 points will be awarded for each fallen glass and a maximum of 20 points will be awarded.
 
 ALLOWED OBJECTS
 1. Dominoes
 2. Funnels
 3. Marbles
 4. All kind of balls ( equal or smaller size than tennis ball)
 5. Toy car
 6. String
 7. Buckets
 8. Cups and Bowls
 9. Ice cream stick
 10. Aluminium foil
 11. Plastic containers
 12. Card board
 13. Water bottles
 14. Tubes & pipes
 15. Cereal boxesn
 16. Batteries & duct tapes to role pully
 17. Ruber bands
 18. Playing cards
 19. Disposable glasses
 20. Balloons
 21. Electrical circuit
 And any other reasonable elements for accomplishment of tasks.



 NOTE
 Minimum 15 elements must be used in the design.
 For support and rigidity of the setup you can use other things (chairs, tables, bricks, etc.) but they shouldn't contribute to the energy transfer in the chain.



Rules:-
 1. Minimum 30 seconds (+1 points for every extra 2 seconds and maximum 20 pts can be awarded)
 2. Without the mandatory tasks in your setup, the team will be disqualified.
 3. For every human interruption, marks will be deducted. (‐3 points after 1 st interruption, (‐3‐5=) ‐8 points after 2nd interruption and (‐3‐5‐8=)‐16 points after 3rd interruption). More than 3 interruptions are not allowed.
 4. If the setup fails then you will be given only 1 more chance to reset your setup. You have to reset within 30 minutes. Failure will be considered as an interruption and will be given -16 points (16 negative points). Reevaluation for last chance will start from -16 points.
 5. Objects must remain within the arena. Once the reaction starts nothing should fall out of the arena points will be deducted if an item (part of setup) falls out of arena (12ft x 12ft).
 6. Once the series starts only one person from the participating team must be within the arena.
 7. Flames and electric appliances (other than batteries & lights) are not allowed.
 8. No AC supply will be provided.

In this event, rally starts with serve. Rally ends when shuttle touches the ground or gets caught by net or when someone commits a faults. You will get 1 point if you win the rally and if you win 21 rallies you win the game. Win the game. The loser will be eliminated.

 Every participant team has to perform a drama or nukkad natak. 
1. One team can have a maximum of 20 members.
 2. Language used can be Hindi or English.
 3. Script should be original/self-written and should not be copied. If found guilty, would result in disqualification of the team.
 4. Vulgarity is strictly prohibited.
 5. Any electronic device or recorded music is not allowed.
 6. Negative points for exceeding the time limit.
 7. Only household objects can be used as props (Dholak, Stick, Drums, Gulaal are allowed). Other props can be used with the permission of event managers.

 Min time: 10 min • Number of participants 1 to 2.

 • Use of slangs, vulgarity and point out any religion are strictly prohibited.
 • Decision of the judges will be final and binding.

Elimination Round : Top 32 teams with minimum time will qualify for the knockout round.
 Knockout Round : The team that drops the top ball first, will be declared as the winner of that particular round.
 

The maximum time given for completing the task is 6 minutes. A setup time of 2 minutes would be given before the start of the run. The machine should not cross the marked line before the start of the run.
 	• The control of the machine by the participants must only be syringes.
 	• The machine has to climb the rope using hydraulic mechanisms only.
 	• The run time starts from the moment any part of the machine crosses the starting line and stops the moment the ball on the topmost platform touches the ground.
 	• Maximum of three interventions are allowed during a trial. Teams will have to start from the previous checkpoint. Time will not be stopped during the positioning of the machine.


 Elimination Round :
 	• The participants should complete the task pushing the ball off the platform which is at a height of 500mm and then proceeding to climb a total height of 1000mm.
 	• The time in this case stops when any part of the machine crosses the 1000mm line.
 	• The only checkpoint in this task will be dropping the ball off the platform.
 	• The run time of all the participants will be noted down and the top 10 teams with the minimum time for completion of the task will qualify for the next round.
 	• The machine should physically come into contact with the ball to push it off the platform.
 
 The knock-out round:
 	• Teams will go two at a time in a race to drop the ball of the topmost platform and the team that pushes the ball out of the top most platforms first will win the knock out.
 	• The participants cannot clear a major checkpoint without clearing any previous major checkpoint i.e. a participant cannot drop the ball of the second platform without dropping the ball off from the first platform.
 	• The machine should physically come into contact with the ball to push it off the platform.
 	• If the organizers feel any necessity to conduct a rerun to differentiate the teams then a rerun will be conducted.
 	• The tubes containing the fluid should not be taut at any point of time while the run is going on and no direct pull or push force should be applied via tubes.
 	• The machine should not damage the ropes in any form. This might lead to disqualification.
 	• It is suggested that people add colours to the fluid used in tubes. This might help them while controlling the machine.
 	• The maximum time limit for the run is 10 minutes. If the team is not able to reach the Finish Line within the maximum time then points will be awarded in accordance to path travelled.
 	• The machine cannot damage the rope in any way.This may attract disqualification from the event.

After receiving the registrations of the participants, the entries will be posted onto Jnanagni 18 Facebook page. An exhibition of this event will be held on the first day of the fest wherein the selected entries will be put up. Finally these selected entries will be judged by a panel of judges to declare the winner and the runner-up of the Third Vision Photo Contest. 
After the judging concludes, the winners will be notified via email sent to their registered email addresses and prizes will be distributed on the last day of the festival – April 8th, 2018.


 Disclaimer 
•The organizer reserves the right to publish entries to its public social networking service accounts throughout the submission period in order to publicize the contest. 
•Although entries are handled with the greatest possible care, the organizer does not accept responsibility for any kind of accidents, damage or loss. 
•Rules and information related to the event may change and nothing could be held liable against the organizer. 
•The decision of the judges shall be final. 
•Entering the contest constitutes agreement to the above mentioned terms and conditions
The team with the maximum number of correct answers is declared the winner. Marks will be decided under expert judgment.

 3. Marks for long narration and passages will be given on the basis of choice of words.
 4. Imaginative writing will be credited bonus points.
 5. Online round will help credit marks for final round

 4)Unique

Levels:- 
 Event will be like two parallel tournaments.
 The last team of both will be the winners
STAGE 1-(QUALIFIER)—
 •15 -20 QUES OF COMMON SENSE AND GENERAL FACT.IN THIS STUDENT WOULD BE GIVEN 20 MINUTS TO MARK THEIR RESPONSES.IN THIS LEVEL ALL REGISTERED PARTICIPANTS ARE ELIGIBLE. 

STAGE 2—
 •QULIFIED STUDENTS WOULD BE DEVIDED INTO 2 STUDENTS EACH. A PAPER GIVEN TO EACH TEAM IN WHICH FIRST SECTION ABOUT SYMBOL UNDERSTANDING. THEN SOME QUES ON CENTRAL IDEA ABOUT EACH CITY,EVENTS ETC.AND FINAL SECTION WOULD CONSIST ONE DESCRIPTIVE QUES. 
•ONLY TOP TEN FROM STAGE 1 ARE ELIGIBLE.
 MAXIMUM PARTICIPANTS-50

Round 1: Accelerator-- 
Here participants have to type the given content in minimum time.On the basis of time taken, top 2 participants from each group will compete in the next round. 

Round 2: Typathon-- 
It is a 5 minute round in which shortlisted students from 1st round will have to compete and those with maximum words per minute speed will qualify for final round. 

Round 3: Do or Die-- 
Selected participants after round 2 will compete in the final round.Maximum of 1 mistake is allowed in this round.On committing 2nd mistake you will be automatically eliminated.


Note:- 
1)If all the participants gets eliminated before finishing the race, then participant with maximum typed content will be declared as winner. 
2)If more than one participant finishes the race then the one with minimum time will be declared as winnnnnnner !!!!!
PARTICIPANTS MUST BRING THERE OWN LAPTOPS.
There will be 2 rounds-
 Round 1: Here participants have to present the overview of their site along with the names of their team members and their contribution in making the site via PPT. 
Round 2: Shortlisted students will have to present their web design along with the code (CD).
